case_vignette: A 63-year-old man comes to the phys   ician for the evaluation of difficulty walking for the last 6 months. He reports weakness in his lower legs that improves wi   th exerci   se and throughout the day. Three mont hs ago, he started    adding flax seeds to his breakfast beca use he is frequently constipated. He has hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus. He ha   s smoked 2 packs of cigarettes daily for the l ast 45 years. His current medications include enalapril and metformin. Vital signs are within normal limi   ts.   Examination shows dry mucous membranes. Muscle    strength in the lower extremities is decre  ased. Sensation to pinprick and light touch is normal   . Deep te  ndon reflexes are 1+ bilaterally. Active muscle contracti   o n or repeated muscle tapping increases reflex activity.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having difficulty walking due to weakness in my lower legs for the past 6 months.
Have you experienced any numbness or tingling in your legs or feet?
No, my sensation to pinprick and light touch is normal.
Do you have any difficulties with bowel, bladder control, or sexual dysfunction?
I haven't mentioned any issues with bowel, bladder control, or sexual dysfunction.
Do you have any other symptoms like visual problems or difficulties with coordination?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing any visual problems or difficulties with coordination.
Have you had any previous episodes of similar symptoms or any other neurological symptoms in the past?
No, I haven't mentioned any previous episodes of similar symptoms or other neurological symptoms.
Do you have a family history of neurological or muscle-related diseases?
I haven't mentioned any family history of neurological or muscle-related diseases.
Have you been on any medications recently or have you been exposed to any toxins?
I am currently taking enalapril and metformin for my hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Final Diagnosis: Diabetic Amyotrophy
